original_definition: 'biomass' means the biodegradable fraction of products, waste and residues from biological origin from agriculture (including vegetal and animal substances), forestry and related industries including fisheries and aquaculture, as well as the biodegradable fraction of industrial and municipal waste;
generated_definition: 'biomass' means biomass refers to solid fuel derived from organic matter, including wood, agricultural and forestry residues, and energy crops.

Article 2: ‘biomass’ means the biodegradable fraction of products, waste and residues from biological origin from agriculture (including vegetal and animal substances), forestry and related industries including fisheries and aquaculture, as well as the biodegradable fraction of industrial and municipal waste;

‘fossil solid fuel’ means solid fuel other than biomass, including anthracite and dry steam coal, hard coke, low temperature coke, bituminous coal, lignite, a blend of fossil fuels or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;

‘fossil solid fuel’ means solid fuel other thanbiomass, including anthracite and dry steam coal, hard coke, low temperature coke, bituminous coal, lignite, a blend of fossil fuels or a blend of biomass and fossil fuel; for the purposes of this Regulation it also includes peat;
‘solid fuel’ means a fuel which is solid at normal indoor room temperatures, including solid biomass and solid fossil fuel;
‘solid fuel’ means a fuel which is solid at normal indoor room temperatures, including solidbiomass and solid fossil fuel;
Article 9: Blended biomass and fossil fuel briquettes
Other blend of biomass and solid fuel
emissions of NOx by open fronted solid fuel local space heaters, closed fronted solid fuel local space heaters and cookers using biomass shall not exceed 200 mg/m3 expressed as NO2 at 13 % O2;
emissions of NOx byopen fronted solid fuel local space heaters,closed fronted solid fuel local space heaters andcookers usingbiomass shall not exceed 200 mg/m3 expressed as NO2 at 13 % O2;
Not Article: The scope of this Regulation should include solid fuel local space heaters designed to use solid fuels (biomass or fossil). Solid fuel local space heaters that have an indirect fluid heating functionality are also within the scope of this Regulation. Solid fuel local space heaters using non-woody biomass have specific technical characteristics and should therefore be exempted from this Regulation.

Solid fuel local space heaters using non-woody biomass have specific technical characteristics and should therefore be exempted from this Regulation.
